document.docAuthor: Huang, Jia, Gong, Lu, Tsaur, Shun-Chern, Zhu, Lin, An, Keying & Chen, Hongwei
document.masterDocTitle: Revision of the subgenus Phortica (sensu stricto) (Diptera, Drosophilidae) from East Asia, with assessment of species delimitation using DNA barcodes

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Revision of the subgenus Phortica (sensu stricto) (Diptera, Drosophilidae) from East Asia, with assessment of species delimitation using DNA barcodes

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis. This species is very similar to
P . kava
Zhu, Cao & Chen, 2018
in the male terminalia (as fig. 3B–D in
Zhu et al . 2018
), but can be distinguished from the latter by the color of pleura and the paramere. In
P . bipartita
: pleura mostly orange to orange-brown; paramere nearly black, bifurcated submedially (as fig. 16 in Toda & Peng 1992 ); in
P . kava
: pleura mostly dark brown to black; paramere mostly yellow, bifurcated from distal 1/3, the anterior branch with 3 pointed teeth apically (as fig. 3D in
Zhu et al . 2018
).

630m
